docs.snippet: The Nationals’ Bryce Harper was in a collision at second base in the top of the second inning, and was back on the field in the bottom of the inning....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nationals’ Bryce Harper was in a collision at second base in the top of the second inning, and was back on the field in the bottom of the inning.
docs.abstract: Analysis; decision by the Washington Nationals to return outfielder Bryce Harper to game after quick concussion evaluation highlights potential dangers posed by a time limit that is unique to baseball; players cannot return to field once removed, giving teams only a brief window to make decision, even as it becomes clearer that potential concussions require careful scrutiny.

headline.main: Checking for a Concussion With the Clock Running
headline.print_headline: Checking for a Concussion With the Clock Running
